Key Match Events: Rafael Devers hit a two-run single in the fifth inning, contributing to a four-run inning.
Devers stole second base and Masataka Yoshida hit an opposite-field RBI double, tying the score at 1-1.
Wilyer Abreu followed with a two-run single, giving the Red Sox a 3-1 lead.
Jarren Duran was hit by a pitch, loading the bases, and Devers lined a knuckle-curve into right for a 5-1 lead.
Tristan Casas bounced into an inning-ending double play.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win.
The coach highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Gerrit Cole (the reigning AL Cy Young Award winner) gave up seven runs, his most since June 9, 2022.

The earliest previous international walks by the Yankees with no runners on both were in the sixth inning: to the Philadelphia Athletics’ Al Simmons by Roy Sherid leading off on Sept. 22, 1930, and to Washington’s Frank Howard by Fritz Peterson with two outs on April 22, 1970.
Others: Rafael Devers entered 14 for 41 (.316) with eight homers against Cole, including the postseason, but was 9 for 53 (.170) with one RBI since Aug. 30.
Zach Penrod, a 27-year-old left-hander, made his big league debut for Boston in the eighth, replacing Josh Winckowski after Aaron Judge’s leadoff double.
Trevor Story singled leading off the fifth and stole second.
Danny Jansen walked and Enmanuel Valdez flied out as Story took third.
The Red Sox selected Penrod’s contract from Worcester and recalled left-hander Bailey Horn from the Triple-A farm team.
Left-hander Cam Booser and right-hander Zack Kelly were optioned to Worcester after Friday night’s 5-4 loss and catcher Tyler Heineman was designated for assignment.

Red Sox: RHP Tanner Houck tentatively is slated to start Wednesday at Tampa Bay. Houck has been bothered by shoulder fatigue and was scratched Friday. He hasn’t pitched since Sept. 4 against the New York Mets.
